headline.main: Ireland to Ban Smoking in Workplace (That Means Pubs, Too)

docs.abstract: Ireland will ban smoking in all workplaces, including pubs and restaurants, starting in 2004; Health Min Michael Martin's announcement angers tobacco manufacturers and publicans alike, who call ban unenforceable and an infringement of personal liberties (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Ireland will ban smoking in all workplaces, including pubs and restaurants, starting in 2004, Health Minister Micheal Martin said today, angering tobacco manufacturers and publicans who called the ban unenforceable and an infringement of personal liberties. The announcement coincided with the Irish Office of Tobacco Control's publication of a study on the effects of secondhand smoke, which found that people who work in smoky environments are up to 30 percent more likely to get heart disease, among other illnesses.
